IRE242H1-F-20235.orgName: Industrial Relations and Human Resources, Centre for (IRE)
IRE242H1-F-20235.courseTitle: HRM for Industrial Relations and HR Professionals
IRE242H1-F-20235.courseDescription:
This course explores the relationship between human resource management, employment relations, and industrial relations. Extensive practical course work will expose students to the functions human resource professionals execute to recruit, select, compensate, train, and evaluate the performance of employees. The course prepares students for advanced HR topics in upper level IRE courses.

Note: Course will not count towards Rotman Commerce program requirements.
IRE242H1-F-20235.prerequisite: 4.0 credits including 1.0 credit from any combination of ECO/ HIS/ POL/ PSY/ SOC with an average grade of 68% across the 1.0-credit combination. Students who do not have all of the required prerequisites are encouraged to contact the academic unit to seek a waiver.
IRE242H1-F-20235.webTimetableInstructions:
Review the course description/restrictions before enrolling in this course.

  • ACORN does not check for prerequisites/exclusions in real time. Students enrolled in courses for which they do not have the published requirements may have their registration cancelled at any time.
  • Do not enrol in course conflicts as accommodations will not be granted.
  • Contact the Program office (IRHR@utoronto.ca) if you have any questions.

enrollmentControls.postName: MA WORK & ORG: SOC SCI CON

IRE244H1-S-20235.orgName: Industrial Relations and Human Resources, Centre for (IRE)
IRE244H1-S-20235.courseDescription: Introduction to the institutions, issues and legislation affecting the employment relationship in the public and private sectors in Canada, with emphasis on collective bargaining. The economic and political environment, history of the labour movement, union organization, certification, contract negotiation, strikes, dispute resolution, contract administration and grievances.
IRE244H1-S-20235.prerequisite: 4.0 credits including 1.0 credit from any combination of ECO/ HIS/ POL/ PSY/ SOC with an average grade of 68% across the 1.0-credit combination. Students who do not have all of the required prerequisites are encouraged to contact the academic unit to seek a waiver.

IRE260H1-F-20235.orgName: Industrial Relations and Human Resources, Centre for (IRE)
IRE260H1-F-20235.courseDescription: Introduction to the nature of organizations and the behaviour of individuals and groups within organizations, including topics such as culture and diversity, reward systems, motivation, leadership, politics, communication, decision-making, conflict and group processes. Not recommended for students in Commerce programs.
IRE260H1-F-20235.prerequisite: 4.0 credits including 1.0 credit from any combination of ECO/ HIS/ POL/ PSY/ SOC with an average grade of 68% across the 1.0-credit combination. Students who do not have all of the required prerequisites are encouraged to contact the academic unit to seek a waiver.
IRE260H1-F-20235.webTimetableInstructions:

  • ACORN does not check for prerequisites/exclusions in real time. Students enrolled in courses for which they do not have the published requirements may have their registration cancelled at any time.
  • Do not enrol in course conflicts as accommodations will not be granted.
  • Contact the Program office (IRHR@utoronto.ca) if you have any questions.
IRE260H1-F-20235.deliveryInstructions: It is recommended that students have a computer with a microphone and camera in order to participate in online activities.

IRE344H1-F-20235.orgName: Industrial Relations and Human Resources, Centre for (IRE)
IRE344H1-F-20235.courseTitle: Topics in Industrial Relations and Human Resources
IRE344H1-F-20235.courseDescription: Topics vary from year to year, but the objective of the course is to discuss current IRHR issues and their economic, legal, political and social implications.
IRE344H1-F-20235.prerequisite: IRE244H1, IRE260H1. Additional prerequisites depending on topic.

LEC-5101.subtitle: Labour Arbitration in the Unionized Workplace

IRE347H1-S-20235.orgName: Industrial Relations and Human Resources, Centre for (IRE)
IRE347H1-S-20235.courseDescription: The role of training and development initiatives in organizations. Students acquire the knowledge and skills to conduct a training needs assessment, identify training objectives, explore strategies to increase the transfer of training, design and deliver a training activity using various training methodologies, and evaluate its effectiveness.

IRE430H1-F-20235.orgName: Industrial Relations and Human Resources, Centre for (IRE)
IRE430H1-F-20235.courseTitle: Canadian Employment Law & the Non-Union Workplace
IRE430H1-F-20235.courseDescription: The course will focus on the law governing employment in a non-unionized workplace. Specifically, it will cover every phase of the employment relationship from hiring to termination and beyond and the rights and obligations of employers and employees as developed by the Courts and under employment-related statutes (namely the Employment Standards Act, 2000 and the Human Rights Code.) The course will also cover provisions from the Occupational Health and Safety Act.
IRE430H1-F-20235.prerequisite: IRE260H1 and 0.5 IRE/IRW credit at the 300-level
IRE430H1-F-20235.webTimetableInstructions:
Review the course description/restrictions before enrolling in this course.

  • ACORN does not check for prerequisites/exclusions in real time. Students enrolled in courses for which they do not have the published requirements may have their registration cancelled at any time.
  • Do not enrol in course conflicts as accommodations will not be granted.
  • Contact the Program office (IRHR@utoronto.ca) if you have any questions.
IRE430H1-F-20235.deliveryInstructions: This is an online course provided asynchronously; video presentations and audio discussions of the topics will be prerecorded and posted semi-weekly. Further details will be provided by the start of the course.

enrollmentControls.postName: MA WORK & ORG: SOC SCI CON

IRE431H1-S-20235.orgName: Industrial Relations and Human Resources, Centre for (IRE)
IRE431H1-S-20235.courseTitle: Canadian Labour Law & the Unionized Workplace
IRE431H1-S-20235.courseDescription: The course will focus on the laws impacting unionized workplaces. It will cover every phase of the Ontario Labour Relations Act, 1995 (the “LRA”) from union organizing, certification, negotiation and bargaining, collective agreement arbitration, retention of bargaining rights and decertification and termination of bargaining rights.
